title: WTB: Charles Sweeney 1888 S.F. Hess California League
author: Rad_Hazard

posts.post_title: WTB: Charles Sweeney 1888 S.F. Hess California League
posts.post_content:
Looking to buy a Charles Sweeney
1888 S.F. Hess California League card.  Please let me know if you have one available.

[quote name="Rad_Hazard" post=2415998]Looking to buy a Charles Sweeney
1888 S.F. Hess California League card.  Please let me know if you have one available.[/QUOTE]

I forgot how many scammers message you when you are looking to buy a card.  Does anyone actually have this card for sale?

I have the N321 but not the N338-1

[IMG]https://baseballcardresource.com/forsale/Collection/NotForSale/1888_N321_Sweeney_TR.jpg[/IMG]
I had the N 338-1 many years ago and auctioned it at one of the Nationals.  The now defunct Legendary Auctions ran the auction.  I wish I had a scan.

Good luck, Jeremy. This is a very rare card; I know of only two copies in the hobby. When you combine this with the tie between Charley Sweeney and Radbourn winning 59 in 1884 and the fact that this is Sweeney's only photographic card it makes it a pretty incredible piece.

[quote name="GaryPassamonte" post=2424542]I had the N 338-1 many years ago and auctioned it at one of the Nationals.  The now defunct Legendary Auctions ran the auction.  I wish I had a scan.[/QUOTE]

You have had some wonderful cards over the years Gary. 

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=617168&d=1712362272[/IMG]

[quote name="dstudeba" post=2424696]You have had some wonderful cards over the years Gary. 

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=617168&d=1712362272[/IMG][/QUOTE]

Is this the one I had?

[quote name="GaryPassamonte" post=2424736]Is this the one I had?[/QUOTE]

Yes, from the Legendary catalog.
